verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites: afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.
verses.web: “Avenge the children of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you shall be gathered to your people.”
verses.ct: "Carry out vengeance against the Midianites on behalf of the people of Israel. After that, you will die and join your ancestors."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the war, and let them go against the Midianites, and avenge the LORD of Midian.
verses.web: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm men from among you for war, that they may go against Midian, to execute LORD’s vengeance on Midian.
verses.ct: So Moses told the people, "Arm some of your men for war. Send them against Midian to carry out the LORD's vengeance.

verses.kjv: Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.
verses.web: You shall send one thousand out of every tribe, throughout all the tribes of Israel, to the war.”
verses.ct: Send 1,000 soldiers from each tribe — every tribe in Israel must contribute."

verses.kjv: So there were delivered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
verses.web: So there were delivered, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
verses.ct: So 1,000 men were selected from each of the 12 tribes of Israel, giving an army of 12,000 soldiers ready for battle.

verses.kjv: And Moses sent them to the war, a thousand of every tribe, them and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy instruments, and the trumpets to blow in his hand.
verses.web: Moses sent them, one thousand of every tribe, to the war with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
verses.ct: Moses sent them off to war — 1,000 from each tribe — along with Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, who carried the holy vessels from the sanctuary and the signal trumpets.

verses.kjv: And they warred against the Midianites, as the LORD commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.
verses.web: They fought against Midian, as LORD commanded Moses. They killed every male.
verses.ct: They attacked Midian, just as the LORD had commanded Moses, and killed every man.

verses.kjv: And they slew the kings of Midian, beside the rest of them that were slain; namely, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian: Balaam also the son of Beor they slew with the sword.
verses.web: They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
verses.ct: Among the dead were the 5 kings of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel took all the women of Midian captives, and their little ones, and took the spoil of all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods.
verses.web: The children of Israel took the women of Midian captive with their little ones; and all their livestock, all their flocks, and all their goods, they took as plunder.
verses.ct: The Israelites captured all the Midianite women and children and seized all their cattle, flocks, and possessions as plunder.

verses.kjv: And they burnt all their cities wherein they dwelt, and all their goodly castles, with fire.
verses.web: All their cities in the places in which they lived, and all their encampments, they burned with fire.
verses.ct: They burned down every town where the Midianites had lived and every fortified camp.

verses.kjv: And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of men and of beasts.
verses.web: They took all the captives, and all the plunder, both of man and of animal.
verses.ct: They gathered up everything they had captured — people and animals alike.

verses.kjv: And they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by Jordan near Jericho.
verses.web: They brought the captives with the prey and the plunder, to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the children of Israel, to the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.ct: Then they brought the captives, the livestock, and all the plunder back to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the whole Israelite community at the camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan River across from Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.
verses.web: Moses and Eleazar the priest, with all the princes of the congregation, went out to meet them outside of the camp.
verses.ct: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the community went out to meet the returning army outside the camp.

verses.kjv: And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.
verses.web: Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from the service of the war.
verses.ct: But Moses was furious with the military commanders — the officers over thousands and the officers over hundreds — as they came back from the battle.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto them, Have ye saved all the women alive?
verses.web: Moses said to them, “Have you saved all the women alive?
verses.ct: "Why did you let all the women live?" Moses demanded.

verses.kjv: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor, and there was a plague among the congregation of the LORD.
verses.web: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against LORD in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of LORD.
verses.ct: "These are the very women who followed Balaam's advice and lured the Israelites into sin against the LORD at Peor! They're the reason a plague struck the LORD's people!

verses.kjv: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him.
verses.web: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known man by lying with him.
verses.ct: Now kill every boy among the captives, and kill every woman who has slept with a man.

verses.kjv: But all the women children, that have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.web: But all the girls, who have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.ct: But spare every young girl who has never slept with a man — keep them alive for yourselves.

verses.kjv: And do ye abide without the camp seven days: whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify both yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.
verses.web: “Encamp outside of the camp for seven days. Whoever has killed any person, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, you and your captives.
verses.ct: "All of you who have killed anyone or touched a dead body must stay outside the camp for 7 days. On the 3rd day and again on the 7th day, purify yourselves and your captives.

verses.kjv: And purify all your raiment, and all that is made of skins, and all work of goats’ hair, and all things made of wood.
verses.web: You shall purify every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats’ hair, and all things made of wood.”
verses.ct: Purify every piece of clothing, everything made of leather, everything made of goat hair, and everything made of wood."

verses.kjv: And Eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to the battle, This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD commanded Moses;
verses.web: Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle, “This is the statute of the law which LORD has commanded Moses:
verses.ct: Then Eleazar the priest addressed the soldiers who had fought in the battle: "Here is the rule from the law that the LORD gave Moses:

verses.kjv: Only the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.web: however the gold, and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.ct: Gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead —

verses.kjv: Every thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make it go through the fire, and it shall be clean: nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of separation: and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make go through the water.
verses.web: everything that may withstand the fire, you shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water for impurity. All that doesn’t withstand the fire you shall make to go through the water.
verses.ct: anything that can withstand fire must be passed through fire to be made clean, but it must also be purified with the water of purification. Anything that can't withstand fire must be passed through water instead.

verses.kjv: And ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye shall come into the camp.
verses.web: You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean. Afterward you shall come into the camp.”
verses.ct: On the 7th day, wash your clothes, and you will be clean. After that, you may return to the camp."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of man and of beast, thou, and Eleazar the priest, and the chief fathers of the congregation:
verses.web: “Count the plunder that was taken, both of man and of animal, you, and Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the congregation;
verses.ct: "You, Eleazar the priest, and the family leaders of the community must take a full count of everything that was captured — both people and animals.

verses.kjv: And divide the prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who went out to battle, and between all the congregation:
verses.web: and divide the plunder into two parts: between the men skilled in war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.
verses.ct: Then divide the plunder into 2 equal shares: one half for the soldiers who fought in the battle, and the other half for the rest of the community.

verses.kjv: And levy a tribute unto the Lord of the men of war which went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the sheep:
verses.web: Levy a tribute to LORD of the men of war who went out to battle: one soul of five hundred; of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks.
verses.ct: From the soldiers' half, set aside a tribute for the LORD: 1 out of every 500 — whether people, cattle, donkeys, or sheep.

verses.kjv: Take it of their half, and give it unto Eleazar the priest, for an heave offering of the LORD.
verses.web: Take it from their half, and give it to Eleazar the priest, for LORD’s wave offering.
verses.ct: Take this from the soldiers' share and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And of the children of Israel’s half, thou shalt take one portion of fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the flocks, of all manner of beasts, and give them unto the Levites, which keep the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD.
verses.web: Of the children of Israel’s half, you shall take one drawn out of every fifty, of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all the livestock, and give them to the Levites, who perform the duty of LORD’s tabernacle.”
verses.ct: From the community's half, take 1 out of every 50 — whether people, cattle, donkeys, sheep, or any other livestock — and give them to the Levites who are responsible for the LORD's tabernacle."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Moses and Eleazar the priest did exactly as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And the booty, being the rest of the prey which the men of war had caught, was six hundred thousand and seventy thousand and five thousand sheep,
verses.web: Now the plunder, over and above the booty which the men of war took, was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,
verses.ct: The total plunder that the army had captured — beyond what the soldiers kept for themselves — came to 675,000 sheep,

verses.kjv: And threescore and twelve thousand beeves,
verses.web: seventy-two thousand head of cattle,
verses.ct: 72,000 cattle,

verses.kjv: And threescore and one thousand asses,
verses.web: sixty-one thousand donkeys,
verses.ct: 61,000 donkeys,

verses.kjv: And thirty and two thousand persons in all, of women that had not known man by lying with him.
verses.web: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of the women who had not known man by lying with him.
verses.ct: and 32,000 young women who had never slept with a man.

verses.kjv: And the half, which was the portion of them that went out to war, was in number three hundred thousand and seven and thirty thousand and five hundred sheep:
verses.web: The half, which was the portion of those who went out to war, was in number three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep;
verses.ct: The half given to the soldiers who had fought in the battle came to 337,500 sheep.

verses.kjv: And the LORD’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred and threescore and fifteen.
verses.web: and LORD’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred seventy-five.
verses.ct: From these, the LORD's tribute was 675 sheep.

verses.kjv: And the beeves were thirty and six thousand; of which the LORD’s tribute was threescore and twelve.
verses.web: The cattle were thirty-six thousand, of which LORD’s tribute was seventy-two.
verses.ct: The soldiers' share of cattle was 36,000, and the LORD's tribute from these was 72.

verses.kjv: And the asses were thirty thousand and five hundred; of which the LORD’s tribute was threescore and one.
verses.web: The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which LORD’s tribute was sixty-one.
verses.ct: The soldiers' share of donkeys was 30,500, and the LORD's tribute from these was 61.

verses.kjv: And the persons were sixteen thousand; of which the LORD’s tribute was thirty and two persons.
verses.web: The persons were sixteen thousand, of whom LORD’s tribute was thirty-two persons.
verses.ct: The soldiers' share of captive people was 16,000, and the LORD's tribute from these was 32 persons.

verses.kjv: And Moses gave the tribute, which was the LORD’s heave offering, unto Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: Moses gave the tribute, which was LORD’s wave offering, to Eleazar the priest, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Moses gave this tribute — the LORD's offering — to Eleazar the priest, just as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: And of the children of Israel’s half, which Moses divided from the men that warred,
verses.web: Of the children of Israel’s half, which Moses divided off from the men who fought
verses.ct: As for the other half that Moses set apart for the community from the soldiers' plunder:

verses.kjv: (Now the half that pertained unto the congregation was three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep,
verses.web: (now the congregation’s half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
verses.ct: the community's half came to 337,500 sheep,

verses.kjv: And thirty and six thousand beeves,
verses.web: thirty-six thousand head of cattle,
verses.ct: 36,000 cattle,

verses.kjv: And thirty thousand asses and five hundred,
verses.web: thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,
verses.ct: 30,500 donkeys,

verses.kjv: And sixteen thousand persons;)
verses.web: and sixteen thousand persons),
verses.ct: and 16,000 people.

verses.kjv: Even of the children of Israel’s half, Moses took one portion of fifty, both of man and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, which kept the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: even of the children of Israel’s half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of animal, and gave them to the Levites, who performed the duty of LORD’s tabernacle, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: From the community's half, Moses took 1 out of every 50 — both people and animals — and gave them to the Levites who maintained the LORD's tabernacle, just as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: And the officers which were over thousands of the host, the captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses:
verses.web: The officers who were over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, came near to Moses.
verses.ct: Then the military commanders — the officers over thousands and the officers over hundreds — came to Moses.

verses.kjv: And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
verses.web: They said to Moses, “Your servants have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our command, and there lacks not one man of us.
verses.ct: They reported, "Sir, we have counted every soldier under our command, and not a single man is missing.

verses.kjv: We have therefore brought an oblation for the LORD, what every man hath gotten, of jewels of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets, to make an atonement for our souls before the LORD.
verses.web: We have brought LORD’s offering, what every man found: gold ornaments, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for our souls before LORD.”
verses.ct: So we've brought an offering to the LORD from the gold items each man collected: armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces — to make atonement for our souls before the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all wrought jewels.
verses.web: Moses and Eleazar the priest took their gold, even all worked jewels.
verses.ct: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from them — all of it finely crafted jewelry.

verses.kjv: And all the gold of the offering that they offered up to the LORD, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
verses.web: All the gold of the wave offering that they offered up to LORD, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels.
verses.ct: The total gold offering presented to the LORD by the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds weighed 16,750 shekels.

verses.kjv: (For the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)
verses.web: The men of war had taken booty, every man for himself.
verses.ct: (The ordinary soldiers had each kept plunder for themselves.)

verses.kjv: And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tabernacle of the congregation, for a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD.
verses.web: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the Tent of Meeting for a memorial for the children of Israel before LORD.
verses.ct: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from the commanders and brought it into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the people of Israel before the LORD.
